story:
Short Summary

Hello! I am producing Eve Ensler's THE VAGINA MONOLOGUES as part of the annual V-Day campaign to raise money for V-Day, an organization that promotes awareness of and fights against violence against women and girls, supporting grassroots, national, and international charities. 

The play will be performed in NYC on Saturday, February 20th @ 8pm and Sunday, February 21st @ 7pm. The Actors Theatre Workshop, 145 West 28th Street, 3rd Fl., New York, NY 10001. 

All proceeds will go directly to V-Day.

http://www.vday.org

What We Need & What You Get

This project cannot be done without your support. We need approximately $1,000 to complete this undertaking. 

The Impact

Your contribution will directly fund the project, with the mission to raise money for V-Day by producing THE VAGINA MONOLOGUES, sparking conversation through creative expression. THE VAGINA MONOLOGUES touches on issues of femininity and womanhood, as well as violence; however, it is ultimately a celebration of what it means to be a woman.

This project is meaningful, and with your help, we can create a beautiful piece of theatre to benefit and remarkable and important cause.

For more information, please "Like" us on Facebook (TVMNYC2016) and "Follow" us on Twitter (@TVMNYC2016).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in the New York City area, consider purchasing tickets to a performance!

http://TVMNYC2016.eventbrite.com

story:
Support Adam Barruch / Anatomiae Occultii and the continued development of his new physical theater production of Stephen Sondheim's masterpiece Sweeney Todd!

Adam Barruch is a Brooklyn based choreographer, who currently creates and performs work under the epithet of his own company, Anatomiae Occultii. He began his career as a young actor, performing professionally on Broadway and in film and television, working with prominent figures such as Tony Bennett, Jerry Herman and Susan Stroman. He later received dance training at LaGuardia High School for Music & Art and Performing Arts. After three years, he graduated early and was accepted into the dance department at The Juilliard School. In addition to creating works for Anatomiae Occultii, in collaboration with long time partner Chelsea Bonosky, he has created works for companies such as Ailey II, Keigwin + Company, Ririe-Woodbury Dance Company, River North Dance Chicago, BalletX, GroundWorks Dance Theater, Graham II and Minnesota Dance Theatre, as well as for dance icons Margie Gillis and Miki Orihara. 

http://www.anatomiaeoccultii.com

Sweeney Todd

In September of 2015,  Adam Barruch was the DANCEworks choreographer-in-residence at the Lobero Theatre in Santa Barbara, California. During this month-long residency initiated by Dianne Vapnek, a group of six performers from New York was led by Barruch to begin the creative process in developing a new production of Stephen Sondheim's masterpiece, Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. During the process, which was mentored by acclaimed choreographer and dancer, Margie Gillis, the company worked with the score to create a new interpretation of this classic work, emphasizing the role in which the body is used to portray both character and narrative. The goal of the four week process was to begin adapting the material and create a new paradigm that would eventually be used to stage a full scaled production. After four weeks of intensive work, the company finished staging the musical material of Act One and performed on the stage of The Lobero Theatre to enthusiastic critics and audiences. 

A year later, in a two week residency held in the heart of Manhattan, the cast reunited to reinvestigate the material and shared it with a New York audience, and once again to critical acclaim. 

We Need Your Support! 

In August 2017, the entire cast is reuniting in upstate New York at Lake Placid Center for the Arts to begin working on the next stage in the creation process for Sweeney Todd...Act II. 

The Lake Placid Center for the Arts is a year-round performing and visual Arts Facility.  Located in the Adirondack Park of Northern New York, the LPCA consistently presents arts of the highest caliber in music, dance and theatre performances, film exhibitions and visual arts presentations. In addition, the Arts Center provides special arts-in education programs, workshops and residencies for aspiring and renowned artists.

Anatomiae Occultii's residency in Lake Placid will be a vital time to develop the second half of Sweeney's development, and bring the project one step closer to it's final goal, a New York Season of the entire musical. 

All money raised will go to funding the performers' and musical director's salaries, travel costs and studio rentals.

story:
OVER EASY by Abaigeal O'Donnell

OVER EASY is a play by Abaigeal O’Donnell that follows four women through the egg donation process. The play has been selected to be a part of SheNYC’s Summer Theatre Festival. Last Summer over easy was featured in the SheNYC Arts virtual festival and will now be returning for the IN-PERSON festival in New York on July 31st, 2021.  We are fundraising in order to cover the costs of artist stipends, rehearsal space, and props. Thank you so much for your support! 

THE TEAM

Abaigeal (Abbie) O’Donnell (Playwright) is a Chicago-based playwright, teaching artist, director, and dramaturg. She is currently an MA Applied Theatre student at Royal Central School of Speech and Drama, University of London. Her play over easy has been developed with NoMads Art Collective, Theatre of the Beyond, Theatre Aspen, and Montclair State University. She received her BFA in Theatre Arts with a concentration in Theatre for Young Audiences from The Theatre School at DePaul University. 

Julia Atkin (Director) is a Chicago-based actor and director. Directing: Strawdog Theatre Co., Arranmore Arts, The Arc Theater, Delivery (short film). Acting: Chicago Shakespeare Theater, Strawdog Theatre Co., Prop Thtr, The Arc Theatre. Film/TV: neXt, Chicago Med, Bug Bites (short). Proudly represented by Stewart Talent Chicago. www.juliaatkin.com.

Nia Blizzard (Production Stage Manager) is a Black theater worker whose passions include (but are not limited to) binge watching reality TV shows, spending time with friends, and advocating for the rights of all Americans. When they are not stage managing, you can find them at the nearest hiking trail or trying to make the world a better place through volunteering at various organizations through their job at Apple. Previous credits include “Rhinoceros” by Eugène Ionesco (ASM, Brooklyn College), “I Am A Positive Person” by Danny Rocco (PSM, Atlantic Theater Company), “Sweet Chariot” by Eric Lockley (PSM, The Movement Theater Company) and The Juneteenth Celebration (Production Assistant, The Broadway League). Follow them @nia_blizzard1!

Juliet Perrell (MARISSA) is thrilled to be joining the cast of Over Easy. REGIONAL: Like the Summer Sun (Lawn Chair Theatre), As You Like It, Titus Andronicus (Shakespeare Theatre of New Jersey), and Seminar (Women’s Theatre Project). TV/Film: Oral (Izzy), Cupid’s Arrow (Amanda). Education: BFA Acting: Emerson College.

Emily Anderson (CHARLOTTE) is an actor and yoga teacher originally from Northern California. Before moving to NYC, she spent some time in Chicago, where she earned her BFA from The Theatre School at DePaul University and originated the role of Justine in the world premiere adaptation of Frankenstein at Lifeline Theatre. It's wonderful to be here sharing this fun and thoughtful play in person! Thank you. 

Penélope de la Rosa (TAYLOR) is an American-Dominican actress, best known for her role as Student in The Equalizer 2 (Film). Her credits also include Mimi in RENT (musical), Lorena in SMILF (Television), and Simone in Alchemy of desire/Dead Man’s Blues (Play). Born and raised in Boston, Massachusetts, Penélope graduated from Emerson College with a Bachelor in Fine Arts Acting and is represented by WSM Talent Agency.

Terrease Rebecca Aiken (KATIE) is a NY based actress, harpist and writer. You may have recently seen her drag racing in a Sunoco commercial and jumping on mattress in a Casper commercial. She is currently working on her first feature film and her YouTube Channel Get Your Vibe Right. 

THE PLAY

Sperm donation can happen with a magazine and a cup, but for people attempting to donate their eggs, things are not so easy. Through awkward moments, hormonal daydreams, dance parties, and the not-fun-kind-of-shots, over easy follows four egg donors from recruitment to extraction.

OVER EASY has been developed with the support of SheNYC Arts, NoMads Art Collective, Theatre Aspen, Theatre of the Beyond, and Montclair State University. The play would not exist without the creative support of the many artists who have supported its development. This will be the first fully-staged production of the play! 

THE FESTIVAL

July 27-August 8, 2021

The SheNYC Summer Theatre Festival is dedicated to showcasing the new, original works of women writers, composers, & directors. 

SheNYC is a group of theater professionals showcasing the talents of writers, composers, producers, directors, and other theater artists who are part of a marginalized gender group, including cis women, trans, and non-binary people. Our mission is to prove that there is no reason for male artists to have the overwhelming majority of produced work in New York City. We provide artists with the resources they need on their path to leadership roles in the industry. 

TICKETS ARE ON SALE NOW!

Tickets for over easy and the rest of the SheNYC Arts Summer Theatre Festival can be purchased here: https://shenycarts.org/she-nyc/

What We Need

  • Stipends for our director, stage manager, and four actors (70%)
  • Rehearsal Space (25%)
  • Props (5%)

Funding raised beyond our initial goal will go directly to the artists involved! 

Thank you!

Spreading the word and donations are so greatly appreciated! Artists have been hit hard by the pandemic so we are so grateful for the opportunity for us to get back to work doing what we love. Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or want to learn more about the play, process, or festival!
story_txt:

The play has been selected to be a part of SheNYC’s Summer Theatre Festival. Last Summer over easy was featured in the SheNYC Arts virtual festival and will now be returning for the IN-PERSON festival in New York on July 31st, 2021.  We are fundraising in order to cover the costs of artist stipends, rehearsal space, and props. story:
• Cuatro desconocidos han sido aislados del mundo en una estación científica en la cima de una helada montaña, a donde una vez al mes se les hacen llegar provisiones. Aunque todos han llegado por su propia voluntad, ninguno conoce exactamente la misión que llevan a cabo ahí pero todos tienen sus teorías. La única instrucción específica que tienen es apuntar un serial que llega a una “computadora”. Poco a poco el aislamiento y las fricciones entre ellos, hacen que algunos vayan perdiendo temporalmente la razón. Las cosas empiezan a salir mal y lo peor viene cuando las provisiones del mes caen fuera de la estación, incapaces de salir por el invierno, no les queda más que saber que todo está perdido y morirán de frío e inanición sin conocer la razón de la existencia de la estación. ¿Tenemos tu atención?
  • Hola a todos, somos Gilary Negrete y Alonso Fiallega, y tenemos en las manos un texto que amamos y nos entusiasma sobremanera.
  • El dinero recaudado será usado para producir en parte la obra Golem que no ha sido producida profesionalmente.
  • El montaje se presentará los lunes del 4 de junio al 20 de agosto de 2018 en el Teatro La Capilla, en Coyoacán, Ciudad de México.
  • El equipo está conformado por Gilary Negrete (actriz y productora), Alonso Fiallega (director y productor), Antonio Alcántara (actor), Tae Solana (actriz), Fernando Canek (actor), Teresa Alvarado (escenografía), Aketzali Reséndiz (vestuario) y Alejandro Turati (diseño gráfico)..
  • Lo recaudado representa el 50% de los recursos necesarios para hacerlo, el resto proviene de nuestros propios bolsillos.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 
  • Necesitamos $ 5,000.00 USD para producir Golem y con tu ayuda podemos lograrlo, ese dinero representa el 50% del total de la producción, el resto lo ponemos nosotros.
  • El dinero será usado para pagar la producción física y asegurar un salario mínimo a los involucrados (exceptuando a nosotros).
  • Tal vez una mención con nuestro agradecimiento no sea suficiente para ti, por eso tenemos más recompensas. Lo que más nos gustaría, por supuesto, es que nos acompañaras en este nuestro sueño y ocupes una butaca (o muchas). Pero no importa la aportación, para nosotros lo importante es tu buena intención, así que de antemano: ¡Gracias!
  • Todos los recursos aunque no se llegue a la meta serán usados en la producción de la obra y no afecta nuestro compromiso a cumplir con todas las recompensas. En caso de superar la meta, esos recursos serán usados para aumentar la publicidad de Golem y así poder buscar llegar a más público e incluso tener una temporada más larga.
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 
  • Sabemos que a veces no es posible ayudar de la manera que quisiéramos, pero si te gusta nuestro proyecto, podrías hacer una gran diferencia difundiéndolo entre tus conocidos.
  • Puedes hacerlo a través de Facebook, Twitter o la red social de tu preferencia. O, si no eres fan de las redes sociales, puedes comentarlo de viva voz.
¡Gracias por leer hasta aquí, pero sobre todo, gracias por tu apoyo!

Lo recaudado representa el 50% de los recursos necesarios para hacerlo, el resto proviene de nuestros propios bolsillos.

 
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

El dinero será usado para pagar la producción física y asegurar un salario mínimo a los involucrados (exceptuando a nosotros).
Tal vez una mención con nuestro agradecimiento no sea suficiente para ti, por eso tenemos más recompensas. Pero no importa la aportación, para nosotros lo importante es tu buena intención, así que de antemano: ¡Gracias!
Todos los recursos aunque no se llegue a la meta serán usados en la producción de la obra y no afecta nuestro compromiso a cumplir con todas las recompensas. En caso de superar la meta, esos recursos serán usados para aumentar la publicidad de Golem y así poder buscar llegar a más público e incluso tener una temporada más larga.

Sabemos que a veces no es posible ayudar de la manera que quisiéramos, pero si te gusta nuestro proyecto, podrías hacer una gran diferencia difundiéndolo entre tus conocidos.
Puedes hacerlo a través de Facebook, Twitter o la red social de tu preferencia. O, si no eres fan de las redes sociales, puedes comentarlo de viva voz.
¡Gracias por leer hasta aquí, pero sobre todo, gracias por tu apoyo!

story:
Short Summary

Wearing Black is a deeply personal piece.

I wrote it not because I crave fame, fortune, or career advancement, but because I need to share the story. I'm trying to make the world a little better through art and that's why Wearing Black was born.

It's had quite the festival life so far:

  • Snapshot with the 2012 West Village Musical Theatre Festival
  • First act debut with the 2013 FRIGID Festival NYC (Best Score)
  • Official selection of the 2015 New York Musical Festival (Outstanding Actor Award)

Now I've established a partnership with The Telling Company to bring it to the next level: an Invited Industry 29-hour Reading.

The Telling Company (TTC) is a not-for-profit organization committed to artistically telling stories inspired by real-life experiences that illuminate personal challenges and galvanize social change.

What is an "Industry Reading" anyway?
We present the show in full to invited industry professionals to establish the team that will ultimately bring the show to the public at large. This includes the investors and producers that will mount the commercial run of the show - allowing it to be viewed by audiences in New York and elsewhere, thereby carrying its message to as many people as possible. With the help of The Telling Company and its fabulous staff and resources, I've never been closer to this goal.

But I need your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

FUNDRAISING SUCKS - Everyone hates to be asked for money. I hate to ask.

But too bad, I need it.

In order to smash this reading out of the park, I need a lot of things that cost money:

  • Creative team - director/MD/GM etc.
  • Broadway actors
  • Broadway musicians
  • Rehearsal/performance space
  • Marketing
  • Hard goods - scripts, props, etc.

...the list goes on an on. This pitch is already quite lengthy and if you've made it this far then you get 10 points.

This industry does not do enough to foster new voices, nor is it designed to mitigate the costs to passionate storytellers. I have to ask for financial help or it can't happen. Is it selfish? I go back and forth. Yes, I'm doing this because it's my passion to tell stories. But over the course of my career my work has provided literally HUNDREDS of jobs for artists. My work has inspired and helped people, made them laugh, made them cry, made them see or face a part of themselves that they wouldn't have been able to otherwise. And that's why I do it - to help people. As cliche as that sounds.

 

The Impact

Your donation is a part of the vibrant culture of New York City. You become an integral part of the creative process when you financially support the arts. With Wearing Black in particular, you help bring a healing entertainment venture about death, addiction and self-destruction to people who might desperately need to hear it.

How many of us have a specific piece of art that has truly influenced our lives for the better? A song, a movie, a book - anything? I'm not saying that Wearing Black is that for everybody, but hopefully it is for somebody. That's why it exists. That's my job. Help me do it.

story:
TITLE:

Burning the Living

SHORT DESCRIPTION:

The Living Theatre, the oldest experimental theatre company in the US, will forge into the desert to directly address the topic of maintaining artistic space in a society that presents constant obstacles for anyone who cannot afford outrageous rent increases and are driven out of neighborhoods by the ever-growing epidemic of gentrification.  The Living will build a multi-orientational fully outfitted theatre that will host an 8 day revolutionary theatre festival centering around interactive performance, collective discussions, workshops, live music, screenings, installations, etc. Resident performers aside from The Living include Bad Unkl Sista, Perf Productions, WalkUpArts, Raindear and others. 

The entire project will be the subject of a feature documentary, chronicling the the journey of The Living Theatre ensemble from New York City into the temporary community of Black Rock City, Nevada. 

Our company deeply values the melding of both our past and our present in the creative process and we are so fortunate with this endeavor, to bring veteran members and younger, newer company members to the Playa, and collaborate with many TLT family members who regularly attend the festival.  We are all very excited to discuss, collaborate and celebrate the genesis and exchange of Art with all in the Burner community.


Your donation will not only contribute to this historical and epic production, but also to help announce the regeneration of a dynamic new era for our company.  

SHORT SUMMARY:

We are The Living Theatre. 

Since 1947, The Living has been committed to using theatre as a powerful way to transform and transcend the boundaries of performance and draw attention to important social and political issues affecting communities both domestically and internationally.  

From its conception, The Living Theatre was dedicated to transforming the organization of power within society from a competitive, hierarchical structure to cooperative and communal expression. The work that has been produced since 1947 until today carries deep anarchist and pacifist messages, involves audience participation and creates an interactive spectacle to create a collective theatrical experience rather than the traditional separation between the performers and the audience. 

Because of the company's extensive history and major contribution to the world of experimental performance, TLT is committed to showing the citizens of Black Rock that The Living and its ideals are not a thing of the past, but instead are alive and well and are relevant now more than ever to the world in which we exist. We are looking to make human connections, perform regularly, expand our networks, discuss the state of the arts today and introduce Judith and TLT to different generations of activists, organizers, artists, innovators and beings who are also actively working towards the Revolution. 

CAMP:

Our camp design is complete! The placement of our camp/theatre at Burning Man has also been finalized! We will be at 6 o’clock right by the Center Camp, as seen below. This placement is fantastic, and will allow us to reach out to a broad range of people and allow us to help facilitate the free exchange of performance on a broader level. 

BUDGET:

After many budget meetings we concluded that our goal for this campaign is $36,000.  

Theatre Structure:                                                             $ 3,500.00

Camp Structure:                                                                $ 2,000.00 

Tech/Power:                                                                       $ 2,300.00

Bio-Diesel Gas (Price Per Gallon):                                 $ 4.89

Equipment (Lighting & Sound)                                      $ 6,000.00

Truck Rental (incl. early festival arrival)                      $ 1425.00

Truck Mileage:                                                                   $ 720.00    

Transportation for elderly TLT members:                   $4,000.00

Transportation for Core Crew Members (12):             $ 4,800.00

Tickets for 11 Core Members:                                         $ 2,090.00

RV Rental for Production/Elderly:                                 $ 3,237.00

Supplies:                                                                              $ 230.00

Food:                                                                                     $ 2,000.00

Water:                                                                                   $ 800.00

First Aid:                                                                               $ 150.00

Camping Supplies:                                                             $ 300.00

Emergency Petty Cash:                                                     $ 2,000.00

TOTAL:                                                                                  $ 35,556.89

TOTAL INDIEGOGO GOAL:                                              $ 39,999.00

Any money over the goal will go directly into future productions of No Place to Hide in NYC and into the company.  No one will be paid for this project.

We are viewing this campaign and project as an investment in our future as a company. We are aiming to re-integrate ourselves into the global framework of current artistic, social and political movements. We see ourselves as theatrical missionaries and will devote any time or money that we have towards bringing about Revolution. 

THE IMPACT:

This campaign is dedicated to bringing The Living Theatre to Burning Man 2014, one of the greatest social experiments to date, in order to exist within a temporary community, contribute wholly, and work wholeheartedly on the beautiful, non-violent, anarchist revolution that Judith Malina continues to inspire us towards. 

As a company that has continued to push boundaries and re-invent themselves over the course of 67 years, this project is geared towards honoring the endeavors and activism of the company's founders and apply those teachings and lessons to inspire us to create new art pertinent to society today. 

This campaign will allow us to showcase the history of The Living Theatre while still maintaing the relevance of the work to both the present and the future of theatre. 

By contributing to our campaign:

1 - you are helping us to address the issue of losing our space in a creative manner

2 - you are helping us formulate a concrete plan for our future as a company

3 - you are helping us manifest this project that will eventually become a documentary about the current state of The Living Theatre and it's 88 year old co-founder

4 - you are helping produce our latest work, No Place to Hide. 

In short, your impact on this campaign is as integral as our impact on the Playa. It is a collective production (whether you are physically at the event or not) that will aid in bringing The Living into a new era.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

Of course, as with any project, there are various risks and challenges involved. 

It is our every hope and intention that Judith will be with us in the desert, but of course due to her age we are facing different challenges regarding her travel and accommodations in Black Rock City. If she does not end up attending, all proceeds associated with Judith will go directly into future productions of No Place to Hide in New York City. 

The size of the company, the harsh conditions, our monetary needs, enduring the physical and mental challenges of performing consistently in the middle of the desert, etc. 

The list is endless. 

We are well aware of everything it entails to embark on such a journey, but our commitment is deep rooted and stimulated by our devotion to the work. 

At 88, Judith is more than excited to venture into the desert and create a fresh dialogue on a long-standing subject that is important for people of all ages to have. 

As an ensemble we are excited to be able to bond in such a challenging environment and develop our work so that it continues to function at a highly disciplined and effective level, a documentary is being filmed that showcases these challenges and obstacles and the circumstances of being displaced while still creating art.  Our latest play captivated NYC audiences and we want to bring that theatrical experience to an event where the motto is "there are no spectators."

These reasons are enough for us to forge ahead regardless of the risks and challenges and instead because of them. 

We have had endless meetings and have constructed plans and back-up plans in case those initial plans don't work. 

Important for all donors to know, is that even if we don't reach the entire goal on INDIEGOGO we'll still go.  Every dollar donated will help us create this. 

Our attraction to this project lies in the fact that it is experimental, unpredictable, demanding, multi-generational and multi-cultural. It is a melding of the minds, the ages, the hearts and the human spirit and that is a risk we are willing to take. :)

HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE:

Promote, converse, muse, contemplate, volunteer on the Playa with our camp, promote, donate, donate, donate, contact us, offer us sagely advice, refer us to friends and networks, share resources, send us love, connect, donate, donate, donate, live. 

UPDATED PERKS:

(anyone who has or is about to claim one of the perks will be benefited as follows)

$50

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in the production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, and 10% off your next Living Theatre ticket purchase. 

$100

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, and 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year!

$250

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, and 1 ticket to a clandestine performance event in Fall 2014.

$500

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, a Living Theatre workshop, and 2 tickets to a special, clandestine performance event in Fall 2014.

$1000

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, a Living Theatre workshop, 2 tickets to a clandestine performance event in Fall 2014, and 2 tickets to a Living Theatre Gala event in Winter 2014. 

$5000

Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, 2 tickets to a clandestine performance event in Fall 2014, and receive a table (6 seats) at a Living Theatre Gala event in Winter 2014.
story_txt:
TITLE:Burning the LivingSHORT DESCRIPTION:The Living Theatre, the oldest experimental theatre company in the US, will forge into the desert to directly address the topic of maintaining artistic space in a society that presents constant obstacles for anyone who cannot afford outrageous rent increases and are driven out of neighborhoods by the ever-growing epidemic of gentrification.  The Living will build a multi-orientational fully outfitted theatre that will host an 8 day revolutionary theatre festival centering around interactive performance, collective discussions, workshops, live music, screenings, installations, etc. Resident performers aside from The Living include Bad Unkl Sista, Perf Productions, WalkUpArts, Raindear and others. The entire project will be the subject of a feature documentary, chronicling the the journey of The Living Theatre ensemble from New York City into the temporary community of Black Rock City, Nevada. Our company deeply values the melding of both our past and our present in the creative process and we are so fortunate with this endeavor, to bring veteran members and younger, newer company members to the Playa, and collaborate with many TLT family members who regularly attend the festival.  We are all very excited to discuss, collaborate and celebrate the genesis and exchange of Art with all in the Burner community.Your donation will not only contribute to this historical and epic production, but also to help announce the regeneration of a dynamic new era for our company.  SHORT SUMMARY:We are The Living Theatre. Since 1947, The Living has been committed to using theatre as a powerful way to transform and transcend the boundaries of performance and draw attention to important social and political issues affecting communities both domestically and internationally.  From its conception, The Living Theatre was dedicated to transforming the organization of power within society from a competitive, hierarchical structure to cooperative and communal expression. The work that has been produced since 1947 until today carries deep anarchist and pacifist messages, involves audience participation and creates an interactive spectacle to create a collective theatrical experience rather than the traditional separation between the performers and the audience. Because of the company's extensive history and major contribution to the world of experimental performance, TLT is committed to showing the citizens of Black Rock that The Living and its ideals are not a thing of the past, but instead are alive and well and are relevant now more than ever to the world in which we exist. We are looking to make human connections, perform regularly, expand our networks, discuss the state of the arts today and introduce Judith and TLT to different generations of activists, organizers, artists, innovators and beings who are also actively working towards the Revolution. CAMP:Our camp design is complete! The placement of our camp/theatre at Burning Man has also been finalized! We will be at 6 o’clock right by the Center Camp, as seen below. This placement is fantastic, and will allow us to reach out to a broad range of people and allow us to help facilitate the free exchange of performance on a broader level. BUDGET:After many budget meetings we concluded that our goal for this campaign is $36,000.  Theatre Structure:                                                             $ 3,500.00Camp Structure:                                                                $ 2,000.00 Tech/Power:                                                                       $ 2,300.00Bio-Diesel Gas (Price Per Gallon):                                 $ 4.89Equipment (Lighting & Sound)                                      $ 6,000.00Truck Rental (incl. early festival arrival)                      $ 1425.00Truck Mileage:                                                                   $ 720.00    Transportation for elderly TLT members:                   $4,000.00Transportation for Core Crew Members (12):             $ 4,800.00Tickets for 11 Core Members:                                         $ 2,090.00RV Rental for Production/Elderly:                                 $ 3,237.00Supplies:                                                                              $ 230.00Food:                                                                                     $ 2,000.00Water:                                                                                   $ 800.00First Aid:                                                                               $ 150.00Camping Supplies:                                                             $ 300.00Emergency Petty Cash:                                                     $ 2,000.00TOTAL:                                                                                  $ 35,556.89TOTAL INDIEGOGO GOAL:                                              $ 39,999.00Any money over the goal will go directly into future productions of No Place to Hide in NYC and into the company.  No one will be paid for this project.We are viewing this campaign and project as an investment in our future as a company. We are aiming to re-integrate ourselves into the global framework of current artistic, social and political movements. We see ourselves as theatrical missionaries and will devote any time or money that we have towards bringing about Revolution. THE IMPACT:This campaign is dedicated to bringing The Living Theatre to Burning Man 2014, one of the greatest social experiments to date, in order to exist within a temporary community, contribute wholly, and work wholeheartedly on the beautiful, non-violent, anarchist revolution that Judith Malina continues to inspire us towards. As a company that has continued to push boundaries and re-invent themselves over the course of 67 years, this project is geared towards honoring the endeavors and activism of the company's founders and apply those teachings and lessons to inspire us to create new art pertinent to society today. This campaign will allow us to showcase the history of The Living Theatre while still maintaing the relevance of the work to both the present and the future of theatre. By contributing to our campaign:1 - you are helping us to address the issue of losing our space in a creative manner2 - you are helping us formulate a concrete plan for our future as a company3 - you are helping us manifest this project that will eventually become a documentary about the current state of The Living Theatre and it's 88 year old co-founder4 - you are helping produce our latest work, No Place to Hide. In short, your impact on this campaign is as integral as our impact on the Playa. It is a collective production (whether you are physically at the event or not) that will aid in bringing The Living into a new era.RISKS AND CHALLENGES:Of course, as with any project, there are various risks and challenges involved. It is our every hope and intention that Judith will be with us in the desert, but of course due to her age we are facing different challenges regarding her travel and accommodations in Black Rock City. If she does not end up attending, all proceeds associated with Judith will go directly into future productions of No Place to Hide in New York City. The size of the company, the harsh conditions, our monetary needs, enduring the physical and mental challenges of performing consistently in the middle of the desert, etc. The list is endless. We are well aware of everything it entails to embark on such a journey, but our commitment is deep rooted and stimulated by our devotion to the work. At 88, Judith is more than excited to venture into the desert and create a fresh dialogue on a long-standing subject that is important for people of all ages to have. As an ensemble we are excited to be able to bond in such a challenging environment and develop our work so that it continues to function at a highly disciplined and effective level, a documentary is being filmed that showcases these challenges and obstacles and the circumstances of being displaced while still creating art.  Our latest play captivated NYC audiences and we want to bring that theatrical experience to an event where the motto is "there are no spectators."These reasons are enough for us to forge ahead regardless of the risks and challenges and instead because of them. We have had endless meetings and have constructed plans and back-up plans in case those initial plans don't work. Important for all donors to know, is that even if we don't reach the entire goal on INDIEGOGO we'll still go.  Every dollar donated will help us create this. Our attraction to this project lies in the fact that it is experimental, unpredictable, demanding, multi-generational and multi-cultural. It is a melding of the minds, the ages, the hearts and the human spirit and that is a risk we are willing to take. :)HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE:Promote, converse, muse, contemplate, volunteer on the Playa with our camp, promote, donate, donate, donate, contact us, offer us sagely advice, refer us to friends and networks, share resources, send us love, connect, donate, donate, donate, live. UPDATED PERKS:(anyone who has or is about to claim one of the perks will be benefited as follows)
$50
Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in the production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, and 10% off your next Living Theatre ticket purchase. 
$100
Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, and 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year!
$250
Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, and 1 ticket to a clandestine performance event in Fall 2014.
$500
Receive the teaser trailer, a special thanks in production materials in both the desert and upcoming events/performances in NYC, 10% off any Living Theatre ticket purchase for the next year, a Living Theatre workshop, and 2 tickets to a special, clandestine performance event in Fall 2014.
$1000

story:
The Campaign

My name is Iris Huey and I am the writer, producer and director of The Love Thing, a laugh out loud stage comedy about relationships.  I am raising money to take this show on the road.  We are starting with two cities, San Diego and Atlanta.  We are starting out small so that we can begin building a fan base while planning for a larger tour.  

About the Show

The Love Thing, which premiered on September 13, 2014 at The Black Theatre Troupe in Phoenix, AZ, is a unique stage play comprised of a series of skits, each dealing with a different but common relationship dilemma.  The show, which is crammed with comedy, also reinforces ideals like communicating honestly, and responding with love.   You can learn more about the show here.

About Me

The Love Thing is the first stage show that I’ve created.  I am also a filmmaker and I have written, produced and directed one feature film (Second Chance) and a few short films, one of which you can check out here. 

Why Donate?

Your support will assist in paying for travel expenses like van rentals, gas, hotel accommodations, food, etc.  It will also help pay for production expenses like theatre rentals, technical crew, cast stipends, etc.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help the campaign by spreading the word and encouraging your friends and family to support this project.

story:
Hello, friends and neighbors. 

Thanks for stopping by our campaign page. With your help, we hope to make the June production of Ye Elizabeths a truly special experience, which will hopefully bring smiles to the faces and songs to the hearts of our audience members.  

Here's a little background on the project and our process:

After improvising together for years with ComedySportz New York and Slapstick Picnic, supporting one another in individual acting pursuits, and even co-starring in a National Radio Commercial, it felt right to start collaborating on some of our writing ideas.  Over the past year through research, improvised inspired writing, late-night musical collaborations and lots of laughter, we developed a story which explores themes of friendship and the ever-changing American Dream and how one might approach the achieving of that dream, even if it means choosing to make enemies along the way.

Ye Elizabeths is a multi-media comedy show, profiling the foibles of two flawed and sheltered historical re-enactors, living and working on a low-rent version of Plimoth Plantation.  When their living history museum goes the way of the buffalo, the girls are forced back into the 21st Century.  With their friendship tested and their dreams on the line they must find a way to marry their Pilgrim lives to these modern times. And, what better way to do that than Reality TV.

Through the writing of Ye Elizabeths and now in its rehearsal and performance, we've gotten to work with wonderful artists who are also great friends.  Here's the team:

Directed by Leah Bonvissuto

With:
Videography & Video Editing by Jeremy Mather
Arrangements by Evan and Sarah Gregory
Lighting Design by Jessie Vacchiano
Stage Management by Chris Petrinovic
Live Accompaniment by Evan Gregory

We've also called upon some of our favorite people, who have been generous enough to lend us their voices/images and time, through their participation is some of the video/audio elements of the play: Jeremy Banks, Ryan Young, Sabrina Farhi, Tim Ruggeri, Lindsey Sproul, Jeff Sproul, and Zachary Gilman.  We cannot thank them enough and are so excited to show audiences their work!

All we need now is a little help from you to defer a portion of the costs of rehearsal space, set pieces & publicity materials, insurance and compensation for our team.  And, we're pretty sure your generosity will be tax deductible (pretty sure).    At the very least, it will give you tons of cool points, and please keep clicking through for our awesome thank you gifts!

Thanks for reading through to the end of our note and for considering a contribution of any amount.  Every little bit helps and warms our hearts!

And, whether or not you are able to pledge at this time, we look forward to seeing you at one of our performances at the Planet Connections Theatre Festivity:

Saturday 6/2/12 - 5pm

Thursday 6/7/12 - 7pm

Friday 6/15/12 - 8:30pm

Saturday 6/16/12 - 3pm

Thursday 6/19/12 - 8pm

hugs and huzzah,

Alicia Barnatchez & Erin Leigh Schmoyer (Elizabeth & Elizabeth)

http://planetconnections.org/ye-elizabeths/

story:
We are excited for this years production of our annual show Rhapsody...the Musical. This year is unique and special because our cast will have the opportunity to perform at Atlanta's 14th Street Playhouse.  This is a venue unlike any other where we have performed in the past.  The show is in its 4th year of production and the full cast is larger than ever before.  The first show for Rhapsody...The Musical was in November of 2010 and held at Shiloh High School in Snellville, GA with a cast of 35 and today we have over 100 cast members!  With its growth, this show has been able to expose Metropolitan Atlanta adolescents and adults to the artistry of musical productions.  Even if you have seen previous year shows you will be surprised with how Rhapsody...the Musical has evolved this year. We have new cast members, new characters, new dances, new songs,...etc. All keeping in the theme of the theme of, "For the Love Music. For the Love of Dance. For the Love of Us."

With this years performance being held at Atlanta's 14th Street Playhouse our production costs are extensive.  We have a goal of raising $7000 in 21 days and we need YOUR help.  There are different levels at which you can contribute. We hope that you will become one of our supporters by contributing at one of the levels below.  

$5 - Ain't to proud to beg

$20 - Gladys Knight's Pips

$50 - Help James Brown's Band

$100 - Save Don Cornelius' Soul

$250 - Don't Let Stevie Wonder

$500 - Respect from Aretha Franklin

$2500 - Amazing Graze

All contributions are tax deductible so please provide your complete mailing address to receive a contribution summary.  You can expect to receive this documentation on or before December 31, 2013. In addition you will be recognized in our program with your name listed on our Patrons Page. 

This year we have made every effort to keep cost down for our cast members.  That is why our fundraising efforts are so important.  We are in need of money for our venue, set, transportation, costumes, additional technical components...etc.  Our production showcases the various talents of Triple 7 Dance Studio Dancers and others within our community who have a passion for the performing arts.  We have a success record of selling out our shows to standing room only status.  Your contribution holds its value in the fact that our production has longevity and continues to grow each year.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please help us get the word out about our Online Campaign by sharing it with Friends, Family, Co-workers, Church Members, Business Owners,...etc.

  • You can forward our Online Campaign via Email 
  • You can share our Online Campaign via Social Media (Facebook/Twitter)

We look forward to your efforts to help making this years production of Rhapsody...the Musical a success.

Please forward all email inquiries regarding this Campaign to t7dpromo@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hey Family and Friends, My name is Danielle Smart and I am currently a senior Professional Theatre Student at North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University. In this last semester I was granted the opportunity to study theatre abroad in West Africa at the University of Ghana. My studies in Ghana will focus on the art forms of the motherland as well as advance my knowledge of distinct cultural differences that enable storytelling specific to pan Africanism.

This campaign is being set forth to cover my flight to Accra, Ghana. The cheapest ticket I've been able to find is $1650. Thankfully, I was awarded a grant for $1500 but it wont cover my whole flight after purchasing a visa, traveler's health insurance, and vaccines. The $10 you contribute will be a great assistance in my arrival at the University in time!  

Theatre has been a passion of mine for as long as I can remember, as a theatre student we are often taught acting methods of Europeans and some Asians but rarely any African art forms. I am looking forward to studying and experiencing theatre and dance from a West African point of view and to bridge the artistic gap between African and American cultures. 

With your help I know i can raise these funds in time so that I will be able to study abroad. I understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but if you can, please forward this link to anyone that you know who might be interested in my campaign. THANK YOU so much!! Please help me to broaden my horizons and raise awareness of different cultures!

story:
The artistic dance group Magic Spurs is a unique combination of traditional dance, break dance and pop music. We would like to travel around and to show the slovak culture to the world. Our project is unique because this type of fusio never existed before. We need a financial support to be able to pay the light design, the music composer and to pay our PR activities, spots. We are desperately looking for a sponsor in this times of crises, because we really want to share our energy, ideas and joy with everybody who is willing to have a great time.

We wanna come to your country and dance for you and your friends!!!

OUR Biggest successes:

2008 - Expo Zaragoza, Spain

2011- Slovakia´s got talent (ended up among the top 10)

2011- Icehockey championship opening ceremony, Slovakia

2011- Los Angeles and Las Vegas tour

2012- London, Olympic games - opening of the slovak VIP house

2012- Lebanon, danceing for politicians, embassadors

Since 2004 lot of musicals, concerts

2012- Lebanon, danceing for politicians, embassadors
Since 2004 lot of musicals, concerts

story:
MY STORY

My name Is Ria. I am a gymnast turned aerialist with a whole lot of dreams and ambition. 

I was a gymnast for over 15 years of my life, but when I was 19; I was forced  to 'retire' due to age. Within the 3 years that followed, I compleatly lost focus of my goals. I let myself go and fell into a rut. 

When I found circus, my life was forever changed. 

Circus has reshaped my ambitions in life, refocused my dreams, and set me on a path. It's not always the clearest path and it's far from easy; but It's what I want do to. My goal isn't to become rich and famous, I just want to perform and share the beauty of the art with anyone I can. 

If you support me in my goal to acquire a trapeze, you will not only be helping me expand my horizons; but place me one step closer to achieving my dreams of flying high in the big top. 




WITH YOUR HELP


A donation of $600 will get earn me a Static Trapeze with safe rigging, spare ropes, and cover the cost of lessons!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Even a $1 donation is one step further to my goal and every little bit will be greatly appreciated!

Even if you can not donate, please share the love and my story. Sharing is convenient and easy, simply click on one of the social networking buttons below!

story:
ABOUT OUR PROJECT

The Beautiful Soup Theater Collective is proud to announce their January, 2012 theatrical event. Running in repertory, audiences are invited to join us to explore Nora Helmer, the complex and brazen young woman who slammed a door in Henrik Ibsen’s A Doll’s House and changed the world in 1879. In NORA, in rep, Beautiful Soup presents a classic look at Ibsen’s play and a new look at the famed Broadway 1982 flop, A Doll’s Life, which is a sequel of sorts.

B.S.T.C is a not-for-profit off-off-Broadway and non-Equity theater company specializing in new looks at classic works. Proceeds from the box offices of our productions are donated to a charity whose mission matches the themes of the play or musical being presented. Proceeds from NORA, in rep will be donated to SANCTUARY FOR FAMILIES, the leading not-for-profit agency in New York State for victims of domestic violence and sex trafficking. Learn more about B.S.T.C at www.beautifulsouptheatercollective.org.


In A DOLL’S HOUSE by Henrik Ibsen and directed by Cristina Carrion, Nora Helmer has a delicious secret that saved her husband's life, but if he finds out what she's done, it might destroy their marriage. Blackmail and innocence, love and hypocrisy collide in one of the most celebrated plays in theater history. A Doll’s House was the first successful play of its era to affirm a married woman's right to her own individuality. It remains one of the most controversial plays about love and marriage ever written, and still retains the power to shock an audience a century after its lead character opened a door to freedom.


The role of Nora Helmer will be played by Collective member KYMBERLY TUTTLE (TWELFTH NIGHT, Lady Olivia)

IN A DOLL'S LIFE: the musica has book and lyrics by Betty Comden and Adolph Green, music by Larry Grossman and is directed by Steven Carl McCasland and musical directed by Jeremy Robin Lyons.

Set within the framework of a contemporary rehearsal of Henrik Ibsen's classic play A Doll's Life, the musical addresses the question of what might have transpired after Nora slammed the door and abandoned her tyrannical husband Torvald. Borrowing the fare from a young violinist, Otto, she takes the train to Christiania, where she accepts work in a cafe and soon becomes tangled in the lives of several men. Throughout the show, scenes in her new life mingle with intermittent flashbacks to the one she left behind. This production marks only the third time the production has seen a New York stage since 1982.

The role of Nora will be played by Collective member MALLORY BERLIN (TWELFTH NIGHT as Viola, MACBETH and ALICE…)


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need $1,500 to pay for all royalty costs to bring "A Doll's Life: the musical" back to the New York Stage. A portion of what's raised will also help pay for audition and rehearsal space. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Take a moment to post this IndieGoGo campaign to your Facbeook, Twitter and Tumblr feeds and show us some love! Every time we're shared, another pair of eyes catches sight and interest builds. Help us make this production a possibility.

story:
The New American Theatre Project


Please help us support new plays
and emerging theatre artists
in Los Angeles!


This season, The New American Theatre received over 1400 plays from American playwrights searching for a venue to tell their stories.

This challenged us to GO BIG! The selection was awe-inspiring and we're very excited to announce this ambitious summer festival of new works. We're calling it The New American Theatre Project. 

This summer, we'll present:

  • 12 new one-act plays performed by members of our professional company
  • Staged readings of 2 brand new full-length plays (63 Trillion by John Bunzel, and Hookman by Lauren Yee).
  • 2 nights of scenes from some of the best plays around to showcase the talents of our ensemble members.

Fall 2014

Then, in the Fall, in honor of his 450th birthday, we'll present Shakespeare's Othello, as well as two American classics, starring our company of seasoned and emerging actors.

About The New American Theatre

The New American Theatre is an award-winning non-profit theatre company based in Los Angeles. An artist-lead company of professional stage, film and TV actors, we've produced over 55 full-length productions and over 90 original one act plays in our short history.  We've enjoyed critical acclaim, awards and nominations from the Los Angeles Times, Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle, The New York Times, Variety, The Hollywood Reporter, Back Stage West, LA Weekly, LA Stage Alliance Ovations, and more. CBS Los Angeles named The New American Theatre as one of the top five  99-seat theatre companies in Los Angeles.  Our professional actor training program helps actors stay focused and working on their art and career.  Click here to go to our website

Here's a short video that shows some of our work throughout the years:


Why We Need Your Help

Even with all of our success, ticket sales only make up a portion of our funding. As a non-profit company, we need support from kind folks like you to help us keep our doors open and fund our projects.  We are asking for $7000 but this really only covers a portion of our budget for the project and certainly for our season. Your contribution will help lesson the overall production costs and help us pay for theatre rental, rehearsal space, stage manager, actors fees, publicity, programs, fees, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please come see our shows and support theatre! Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.  And please remember to like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and tell all your friends to do the same!

Thanks for reading, and thanks for your support!

- Your friends at The New American Theatre.


Want to see something cool? Here's a trailer of a documentary about The New American Theatre!

story:
PICASSO'S WOMEN: THE DARKER SIDE OF GENIUS is a fascinating and educated look into the private lives of the celebrated and mysterious art icon Pablo Picasso, and the women that were at some point caught in the devastating tornado of loving him.


The play provides an entirely new perspective and understanding of Picasso, his art, and inspirations to those who might be unaware of the intricate, delicate, and often times complicated inner workings of his personal life.


More specifically, this play focuses on six women who's stories are overlooked by a world obsessed with an icon it praised nearly to the point of deification; a world that never saw him as the man he really was, a world that never knew the women he trampled.


"I want you to tell your stories, Don't you see? We could tell the truth, show the world what Picasso was really lIke, what he did to us. We could call it Picasso's Women, or something similar. You could say whatever you wanted to. Most people think of us as temporary helpers, insignificant muses, disposable models and sex slaves for him; and each of us ready to stab the one before so we could occupy that position. And so we've always been at each other's throats. Now we don't have to be. Now we can redefine ourselves- and him." FRANCOISE GILOT - PICASSO'S WOMAN: THE DARKER SIDE OF GENIUS 


Ball Point Productions is also creating a "Making of Picasso's Women" documentary to give back to the people that contribute a minimum of 20 dollars to this amazing endeavor, as well as to add a bit of permanence to this theatrical portrayal of history as the world deserves to have it and in honor of these incredible women that inspired and possessed Picasso as much as he inspired and possessed them. 


And further, those (in the US) who contribute 25 dollars or more will receive, along with the "Making of Documentary," a Recorded Performance of the Entire Play.*

Congratulations to the cast and crew of PICASSO'S WOMEN: The Darker Side of Genius on completing this beautiful and provocative theatre production, despite ANY obstacles! We, at Ugo Indie-Go, have been SO inspired and honored to be a witness to the Magic you have all created together, and not just the play, but also the amazing fire and chemistry that radiated in and through each of you and towards each other. 

While we now have the ability to share, to a certain degree, this experience with people all over the world via the video production of Picasso's Women: The Darker Side of Genius, we can never truly relate to anyone what it was like to be in the midst of All OF YOU when you were In Your Element. The Elements that each of you took direct hold of and formed into gold with YOUR Cohesive Collaboration and Masterful Skills of Theatre Alchemy. All together, the whole lot of you truly was and is The Brighter Side of Genius, Aramazd's Women... and Fellas's too. :)

Thank you to everyone who contributed so far! You're contributions have made a world of difference! You are a shining light and the evidence that one day-

 The Theatre Will Thrive - It's Time for a Theatre Revolution! 

SO please make a contribution big or small and JOIN US in Taking the Stage and Choosing the Message, after all:

"All the worlds indeed a stage, and we are merely players." - The Bard

Visit Picasso's Women: The Darker Side of Genius on FaceBook for more info.

BUT THAT'S NOT ALL!

Check out our list of fantastic Perks ——>

Thank you for your careful consideration and for finding an interest in this particular group of professionals who's dedication and terrific work ethic was so easy to capture, that has inspired us to create this campaign for them.

That was our contribution, which we hope in turn inspires YOU to contribute too!

Oh yeah! All donations are tax deductible to the extent permitted by law! Yeah, non profit!

LINKS TO MORE VIDEOS:

The Aramazd - A word from the Director http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PiaidaICZq0

LINK TO REVIEW:

 http://tolucantimes.info/section/theatre_review/picassos-women-the-darker-side-of-genius/

- Ball Point Productions            

Want your production documented and recorded?

Contact us at: BallPointProductions@gmail.com

Need an Indiegogo campaign? Contact us at: ugo.indiego@gmail.com

story:
*Classics in Color: An INclusive Theatre Company is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Classics in Color must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.*

My name is Nafeesa Monroe and I'm the founder and artistic director of Classics in Color: An INclusive Theatre Company. Our mission is about inclusivity, not just on stage but off, in ethnicity, in gender, and in physical able-ness. We want the world to see themselves in our productions of classic and classical works. Through our work we hope to demystify the classics and create accessible theatre to which we all can relate. We want all people to be able to see a version of themselves on stage, to feel included. We are bringing Shakespeare and the classics back to the people.

We’re raising 20,000 for our next production: Shakepseare’s Much Ado About Nothing. When choosing our next production, we wanted to choose a show that truly represented much of what Classics in Color has to offer as a theatre company. Much Ado, a comedy with drama, led by a strong, quick witted female character; set against the reality of men returning home from war;  ultimately about love and forgiveness, allows us to make our Classics in Color inclusion mark on the classics.

After November 9th of this year, we spent a lot of time deliberating whether or not to go forward with our next production, wondering if now was the time to raise money and ask people to support art. We know there are numerous organizations that will also need our money, our energy, and our time. We had several conversations with several company members. The largest take away from these conversations was this: Our country is clearly in a place of much disconnect. Although many worthy organizations that support the rights of everyone, who fight for justice, who help organize like minded people, must be supported, these organizations are not in the business of changing people’s hearts and minds, and this, my friends, is what we need most. The arts have a unique ability to reach and change hearts and minds. It is with this in mind, we choose to move forward with our scheduled 2017 heart centered production of Much Ado About Nothing.

Our Much Ado will be cast and designed inclusively; it will demonstrate a community of people of different backgrounds, ethnicities, and different ableness working together to bring a beautiful piece of accessible theatre to life. Directed by yours truly, CiC’s Much Ado will be set in the present, in the real world of friends returning from war, of true love being both easy to find and hard to admit, and of misunderstandings and reconciliation.

This first round of fundraising will be used for:

  • Our down payment to secure an accessible theatre rental for our three week run in the fall of 2017
  • Secure our insurance for the space and the actors
  • Pay for space rental for both auditions and rehearsal.

If you’d like to see a breakdown of our budgeting needs, please reach out, we would be more than happy to share it with you as we believe wholly in maintaining financial transparency.

Every donation is tax-deductible. If you choose a gift for your donation, the tax deductible amount is everything above the cost of the gift.

We are incredibly grateful for your collaboration in the work of Classics in Color: An INclusive Theatre Company. Without you, none of what we do is possible.

Let us change hearts and minds with our art. Let us work together, make art together, reach each other, listen to each other, and hear each other. No one said it was going to be easy. But the journey is worth it if we make it together. Classics in Color: classics by all the people, for all the people.

story:
Loosely inspired by Chekhov’s THE SEAGULL, BLACK DOVES follows a middle class African-American family in present day Brooklyn, New York. When a loved one commits an unforgivable crime, will the family deal with the generational trauma that has shaped their lives or will they choose to ignore it, which only continues the cycle?

BLACK DOVES is going to be further developed at HB Studio, thanks to their Rehearsal Space Residency. The Residency gives me two months of free space and time to work with actors and my amazing director Emily Lyon as we seek to dive deeper into what it means to carry around generational trauma. However, HB does not provide a budget to pay actors so they are expected to work for free.  

So we need your help!

Every dollar contributed goes toward paying my actors for their amazing work over these next two months. As working professionals, they deserve to be compensated for their time, talent and insights.

story:
The Collective aims to offer opportunity to both working professionals and those wanting to work professionally in theatre.
Its aim is to reward the most talented performers based on just that - talent!

We give performers every opportunity to succeed, with longer audition times and the opportunity to workshop the piece from the initial audition.

Geordie Worland, founder of The Collective, has been involved in theatre in some way, shape or form for most of his life; as performer, musician and now producer.

With a strong back ground in business development and project management he is passionate about making sure that the idea and concept of The Collective is managed correctly to provide longevity in the theatre industry. It is paramount to get both the business and creative aspect of production 100% right in order to succeed in the industry.

What we need

The costs of running and setting up a theatre company are many to say the least. Due to unfortunate circumstances The Collective has had two major backer back out due to severe personal reasons so crowd funding has become crucial. So much goes into creating outstanding theatre and all involved should be rewarded for the role they play.

As an emerging company The Collective will be looking to use the funds raised to cover the following:

1. Sets and Costumes - $7000

2. Lighting and Technical Support - $2000

4. Theatre Hire and associated expenses - $6000

Contributors will be rewarded with great perks, including tickets to the show, opening night and cast meet and greet. 

    The Collective

    The Collective is a production company that will produce professional theatre, with a focus on Music Theatre in Melbourne. 
    Its aim is to produce at least one fully staged musical a year as well as cabarets. 
    It also aims to have a scholarship program in place within its first 12 months, providing monetary assistance and a mentor program for up and coming performers who wish to further their studies.

    In its unique approach The Collective is set up as just that – a collection of performers, directors, musical directors, choreographers and production roles who jointly create a vision for each piece it produces. The company is set up to equally financially reward those involved for their input.

    Mission Statement


    - To provide a collective approach to outstanding professional theatre
    - To add diversity to the Melbourne theatre landscape, particularly within the music theatre industry
    - To provide an avenue for  emerging and established artists alike to be involved in high quality, professional theatre
story_txt:
The Collective aims to offer opportunity to both working professionals and those wanting to work professionally in theatre.Its aim is to reward the most talented performers based on just that - talent!We give performers every opportunity to succeed, with longer audition times and the opportunity to workshop the piece from the initial audition. Geordie Worland, founder of The Collective, has been involved in theatre in some way, shape or form for most of his life; as performer, musician and now producer.With a strong back ground in business development and project management he is passionate about making sure that the idea and concept of The Collective is managed correctly to provide longevity in the theatre industry. It is paramount to get both the business and creative aspect of production 100% right in order to succeed in the industry.   What we need The costs of running and setting up a theatre company are many to say the least. Due to unfortunate circumstances The Collective has had two major backer back out due to severe personal reasons so crowd funding has become crucial. So much goes into creating outstanding theatre and all involved should be rewarded for the role they play.
As an emerging company The Collective will be looking to use the funds raised to cover the following:
1. Sets and Costumes - $7000
2. Lighting and Technical Support - $2000
4. Theatre Hire and associated expenses - $6000
Contributors will be rewarded with great perks, including tickets to the show, opening night and cast meet and greet. 

  The Collective

Its aim is to produce at least one fully staged musical a year as well as cabarets.

story:
Short Summary

" By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes."

This project began as a single image and a setting.  The setting was an asylum and the image was Lady Macbeth obsessively scrubbing her hands with a wire scrubbing brush, making more blood with every desperate attempt to get clean. The futility and vulnerability of this cracking mind fuelled by this insatiable inner fire really spoke to us.

We are Abstract Sentiment Theatre Company and we create an immersible artistic platform that implicates the collision between art, dance, music and theatre. It focuses on experimentation of new works as well as revisit the classical works with an inventive theme. 

We desire to give writers, actors, artists and directors not only a voice and a place to nurture their talent but a challenge.

Our company has a reputation for working in non-traditional spaces and under an immersive format in an attempt to connect to audiences and push theatre in a new and more interesting direction. Our intention with this production is to put the audience right in the middle of Macbeth’s brutal and ambitious path.

What We Need & What You Get

To make this amazing production happen, we need your help! We need to raise $7,000 to partially cover production costs. Some of these costs include:

Rehearsal space: $1000

Costumes: $1000

Sets & props: $1000

Crew stipend: $1000

Actors' stipend: $3000

With the help of your donations, we can bring the Shakespeare's deliciously tragic words and evil deeds to the stage!

In return for your generous support, you will receive our undying gratitude, the director's love and devotion, and some other really cool stuff:

Your name listed in our production program!

A copy of a rehearsal script signed by the cast!

An autographed MACBETH production photo!

Access to the Opening Night Reception!

Macbeth's crown!

Complimentary VIP tickets!

And more! Just check out the perks!

Or all of the above (if you're REALLY generous)!

...AND you'll have the satisfaction of knowing that you are part of an effort to bring non-profit classical theatre to the stage.

We only have 30 days to reach our goal, so please give early, and give often! And remember, no amount is too small. If we reach our goal, all the funds go towards our production costs.

Many, many thanks for your generous support!

    Risks & Challenges

    One of Shakespeare's greatest plays, Macbeth tells the story of the treacherous rise and bloody fall of the King of Scotland. Informed by a trio of witches that he is destined to become King, Macbeth and his wife go to greater and greater lengths to attain and to hold onto this goal.

    Set in a war torn community known as Scotland, at a time when the gears of power are beginning to shift. Families struggle for survival; lords dominate the high-rises and children possess insight and wisdom way beyond their years.

    This is a complicated production to mount.  To create the play as we see it, we need seamless effects, costumes, lighting and sound. 

    Fortunately, we've done this before! 

    Your donation IS the key to help us solve these challenges!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Can’t contribute? Don’t feel bad. You can still be part of the effort! 

      Please share our campaign with friends, family, lovers, fans of theatre and fans of Shakespeare. 

      Help us get out the word about the epic journey upon which we are about to embark!And feel free to contact us if you are interested in volunteering your services etc!

story:
Hello There!

Allow us to introduce ourselves: we’re Three, A Performance Group. But more specifically, we’re Gabi, Jenny, Matthew, Yolanda, and Michelle, and it’s lovely to meet you! We put together this little group for one purpose: theatre. After graduating from the theatre program at the University of New Mexico, we came together to support each other in our artistic endeavors. 

Now we’re producing not one, but two shows about the Trojan War: Cassandra an original work by Jenny, Yolanda, and Matthew and An Iliad by Lisa Peterson and Denis O'Hare. But we can’t do it alone. Between rights, props, costumes, and all the fun little tidbits that go into a show, we are needing funding to make our dreams a reality! And any bit helps!

What We Need & What You Get

Our ultimate goal is to reach $2500 as a combined budget for both shows. This will ensure coverage of all the essentials for which we have accounted, such as advertising, costumes, and props, but also to cover unseen issues and costs.

As a huge thank you for all your love and support, we want to make sure you get some fun perks in return! Some are discounted tickets, or thank you notes from us, all the way up to a personal Skype mini-performance, or your own curtain call at one of our shows! Check out more of our perks right over there to your right!

Even if we don’t reach our entire goal, any funding we can get towards these two projects will help.

An Iliad

By Lisa Peterson & Denis O'Hare

An Iliad switches the focus of the Trojan War from epic grandeur to the human soul. An ancient  poet, tasked to retell this story for eternity, not only tells the story of that famous war countless years ago, she becomes it. She becomes every soul, every god, and every heartbreak. Long has she lost her identity to this world as she desperately needs her audience to recognize mankind’s love of violence, and the humanity it destroys. For her, the Trojan War is not simply a fairy tale, but a true, haunting horror.

Cassandra

By Matthew McVey-Lee, Jenny Hoffman, & Yolanda Knight

Cassandra is our original work. To create our narrative we have combined classic Greek text, modern original text, opera, pop, and movement to get to the heart of the story of the Trojan prophet and princess. We (Jenny, Yolanda, and Matthew) have worked as editors, co-writers, actors, and director to share an untold story of an almost hero. Cassandra fails to convince her family and nation of the impending destruction of Troy, she becomes a casualty of the influence of those around her. Her story is a tragic portrait of romance, betrayal, madness, and war. 

Show Dates and Locations

An Iliad
by Lisa Peterson & Denis O'Hare
Directed by Michelle Lawson

In Albuquerque:                                                  In Santa Fe:
May 22-24, 2015                                                Friday June 5, 2015 at 7:30 pm  
Friday and Saturday 7:30 pm                        Saturday June 6, 2015 at 2:00 pm 
Sunday 2:00 pm

Cassandra
by Matthew McVey-Lee, Jenny Hoffman, & Yolanda Knight
Directed by Matthew McVey-Lee

In Albuquerque:                                                  In Santa Fe:
May 29-31, 2015                                                 Saturday June 6, 2015 at 7:30 pm  
Friday and Saturday 7:30 pm                        Sunday June 7, 2015 at 2:00 pm
Sunday 2:00 pm
                                                                                              
Albuquerque at :                                          Santa Fe at: 
Tricklock Performance Laboratory               Teatro Paraguas  
110 Gold Ave SW                                                  3205 Calle Marie Suite B 
Albuquerque, NM 87102                                   Santa Fe , NM 87507

                                                                                                            

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute monetarily, here are some ways you can help out:

  • Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or your social media of choice!
  • Hand out the little business cards we have with our Indiegogo link!
  • Comment, like, and share content on our page. With lots of activity comes more exposure in the Indiegogo community!
  • Simple word of mouth can never go wrong!
  • Come see the shows! We'd love to see your smiling face (or scowling face, but we'll leave that up to you!)

Thank you in advance for your investment of love and support through this process! 

You guys are the best!
